variable.name: SUBJID
variable.description: De-identified Subject ID.
variable.comment: Anonymous ID generated by GENEVA Coordinating Center to replace local ID's.

variable.name: CONSENT
variable.description: Consent restrictions on type of research permissible.
variable.value: Limited to genetic studies relevant to oral health.

variable.name: GENDER
variable.description: Gender of participant.

variable.name: RACE
variable.description: Race of participant.

variable.name: ETHNICITY
variable.description: Ethnicity of participant.
variable.comment: Not all values have been used, but should be retained in the data dictionary.

variable.name: CLEFT_I
variable.description: Cleft Status of participant - general specification.

variable.name: CLEFT_II
variable.description: Cleft Status of participant - exact specification.
variable.comment: Not all values have been used, but should be retained in the data dictionary. Derived from 'LAHSHAL' where laterality and completeness of cleft are recorded for the lip, alveolus, hard palate, and soft palate.

variable.name: M_RACE
variable.description: Race of participant's mother.
variable.comment: Not all values have been used, but should be retained in the data dictionary. -9999 is also a valid value indicating 'missing', but does not reflect the minimum data value for a field.

variable.name: M_ETHNICITY
variable.description: Ethnicity of participant's mother.
variable.comment: Not all values have been used, but should be retained in the data dictionary. -9999 is also a valid value indicating 'missing', but does not reflect the minimum data value for a field.

variable.name: M_CLEFT
variable.description: Cleft Status of participant's mother - general specification.
variable.comment: Not all values have been used, but should be retained in the data dictionary. -9999 is also a valid value indicating 'missing', but does not reflect the minimum data value for a field. Derived from LAHSHAL where laterality and completeness of cleft are recorded for the lip, alveolus, hard palate, and soft palate.

variable.name: F_RACE
variable.description: Race of participant's father.
variable.comment: Not all values have been used, but should be retained in the data dictionary. -9999 is also a valid value indicating 'missing', but does not reflect the minimum data value for a field.

variable.name: F_ETHNICITY
variable.description: Ethnicity of participant's father.
variable.comment: Not all values have been used, but should be retained in the data dictionary. -9999 is also a valid value indicating 'missing', but does not reflect the minimum data value for a field.

variable.name: F_CLEFT
variable.description: Cleft Status of participant's father - general specification.
variable.comment: Not all values have been used, but should be retained in the data dictionary. -9999 is also a valid value indicating 'missing', but does not reflect the minimum data value for a field. Derived from LAHSHAL where laterality and completeness of cleft are recorded for the lip, alveolus, hard palate, and soft palate.

variable.name: FAMHX
variable.description: Family history of clefting (more than one individual in the family has a cleft).
variable.value: Negative family history of Oral Clefts
Positive family history of Oral Clefts

variable.name: MSMOKE_PRIOR
variable.description: Participant's mother smoked three months prior to pregnancy.
variable.comment: Not all values have been used, but should be retained in the data dictionary. -9999 is also a valid value indicating 'missing', but does not reflect the minimum data value for a field.

variable.name: MSMOKE_3MON
variable.description: Participant's mother smoked first three months of pregnancy.
variable.comment: Not all values have been used, but should be retained in the data dictionary. -9999 is also a valid value indicating 'missing', but does not reflect the minimum data value for a field.

variable.name: MSMOKE
variable.description: Participant's mother smoked in perinatal period (three months prior through third month of pregnancy).
variable.comment: Not all values have been used, but should be retained in the data dictionary. -9999 is also a valid value indicating 'missing', but does not reflect the minimum data value for a field. Derived from variables=MSMOKE_PRIOR and MSMOKE_3MON, where 0 indicates a negative response to both time periods, 1 indicates a positive response to at least one time period, and -9999 indicates responses to both time periods either -9999 or 0 and -9999.

variable.name: MVITS_PRIOR
variable.description: Participant's mother took vitamins three months prior to pregnancy.
variable.comment: -9999 is also a valid value indicating 'missing', but does not reflect the minimum data value for a field.

variable.name: MVITS_3MON
variable.description: Participant's mother took vitamins first three months of pregnancy.
variable.comment: -9999 is also a valid value indicating 'missing', but does not reflect the minimum data value for a field.

variable.name: MVITS
variable.description: Participant's mother took vitamins in perinatal period (three months prior through third month of pregnancy).
variable.comment: -9999 is also a valid value indicating 'missing', but does not reflect the minimum data value for a field. Derived from MVITS_PRIOR and MVITS_3MON, where 0 indicates a negative response to both time periods, 1 indicates a positive response to at least one time period, and -9999 indicates responses to both time periods were either -9999 or 0 and -9999.

variable.name: MDRINK_PRIOR
variable.description: Participant's mother drank alcohol three months prior to pregnancy.
variable.comment: -9999 is also a valid value indicating 'missing', but does not reflect the minimum data value for a field.

variable.name: MDRINK_3MON
variable.description: Participant's mother drank alcohol first three months of pregnancy.
variable.comment: -9999 is also a valid value indicating 'missing', but does not reflect the minimum data value for a field.

variable.name: MDRINK
variable.description: Participant's mother drank alcohol in perinatal period (three months prior through third month of pregnancy).
variable.comment: -9999 is also a valid value indicating 'missing', but does not reflect the minimum data value for a field. Derived from variables=MDRINK_PRIOR and MDRINK_3MON, where 0 indicates a negative response to both time periods, 1 indicates a positive response to at least one time period, and -9999 indicates responses to both time periods were either -9999 or 0 and -9999.
